hand.name: Time Elemental
hand.text: After this turn, take an extra turn (even if the end of the game has been triggered).

hand.name: Two-Headed Dragon
hand.text: You may upgrade 1 of the pieces used to summon the Two-Headed Dragon. If you do, you may destroy 1 heroic piece adjacent to the upgraded piece.

hand.name: Demon of Lust
hand.text: Choose up to 2 pieces (not necessarily yours). With each, do 1 combat move toward the Gateway. These moves must not destroy the Gateway.

hand.name: Acolyte of Growth
hand.text: Place a common piece of your color on an empty square. If the Gateway is on a green square, place a heroic piece of your color on an empty square adjacent to that new common piece.

hand.name: Vortex Master
hand.text: You may do 1 combat move with the Gateway. Whether you do or not, you may then do 1 combat move with one of your pieces adjacent to the Gateway.

discard.name: Demon of Gluttony
discard.text: The Demon of Gluttony may do a combat move. If this destroys a piece, upgrade Gluttony and it may do another combat move.  If this destroys another piece, Gluttony becomes the Gateway.

discard.name: Demon of Sloth
discard.text: Spend an action to do nothing. If you cannot, destroy the Gateway instead.

discard.name: Acolyte of Destruction
discard.text: Destroy a common piece. If the Gateway is on a red square, you may also destroy a heroic piece adjacent to the destroyed piece's square.

discard.name: Possessed Summoner
discard.text: Place a common enemy piece on an empty square adjacent to a piece of the same color. For your next summoning this turn, use pieces of that color instead of your own. You may discard your flare to gain an action.

discard.name: Shadow Imp
discard.text: The Shadow Imp may do 1 combat move. If it does and it is not the Gateway, then the Gateway may do 1 combat move in the same direction

discard.name: Gate Keeper
discard.text: You may upgrade any one of your common pieces or place a common piece of your color on an empty square.  In either case, that piece becomes the Gateway.

discard.name: Demon of Envy
discard.text: Place a common piece of your color on an empty square adjacent to the Gateway. Then repeat this until there is no such empty square or until no opponent has more pieces than you do.

discard.name: Demon of Greed
discard.text: Destroy one of your common and one of your heroic non-Gateway pieces. For each destroyed piece, gain an action.

discard.name: Flame Imp
discard.text: You may destroy a common piece adjacent to the Gateway.

discard.name: Power Seeker
discard.text: If the Power Seeker is the Gateway, it may do 1 standard move. Otherwise, it may do any number of combat moves towards the Gateway.

discard.name: Gate Master
discard.text: Upgrade the Gateway. Then choose 1 of your non-legendary pieces to become the Gateway. If upgrading created a legendary piece, then Gate Master's summoning counts as summoning a legend on Gate Master's square.
